hypothesis_content.title: Gas Volatility Expansion -> ETH Implied Volatility Lead Indicator
hypothesis_content.statement: A >100% week-over-week increase in the standard deviation of daily average gas prices predicts a >15% increase in ETH 30-day implied volatility (Deribit) over the next 3 trading days, as gas uncertainty signals broader network congestion and fee market stress.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Gas volatility reflects uncertainty in Ethereum block space demand, often preceding periods of network congestion and fee spikes. Options markets may be slow to price this uncertainty, creating a predictive edge.
entry_conditions: Weekly std dev of daily avg gas price > 2x previous week's std dev
ETH 30-day IV (Deribit) has not already risen >10% in past 3 days

exit_conditions.take_profit: ETH 30-day IV increases by 15% from entry level
exit_conditions.stop_loss: ETH 30-day IV decreases by 5% from entry level

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Gas volatility spikes fail to predict IV increases; IV remains flat or declines despite gas uncertainty.
